info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 28 at 7:08PM MST until June 28 at 10:15PM MST by NWS LasVegas
info.description: The National Weather Service in Las Vegas has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Flag Burn Scar in... Southern Mohave County in northwestern Arizona... * Until 1015 PM MST. * At 708 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Flag Burn Scar. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the Flag Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Flag Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Wild Cow Campground, Hualapai Mountain Park and Hualapai Peak. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Flag Burn Scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
